HTML: Arranging Images in Horizontally Scrollable Rows

See browser's Code Inspector for details.

Single Image With Caption

At first only one image to demonstrate the basic complex of image and caption

With HTML figure

figure would be straighforward since it semantically clear encapsulates an image with a caption (figcaption). Unfortunatly there were cases where it didn't work with overflow tweaking (see below).

Styling is necessary to align the caption midth under the image.

Used styles: figure { text-align: center ; }

With HTML div

div is always suboptimal due to its lack of semantic and suits as a last resort only. With it there is also no semantically clear element for the image caption, the least complicated choice is p for containing a text block. Semantic roles should be expressed by classes (with class names that are not reflecting styling details).

Fig. 1

Styling is necessary to align the caption midth under the image.

Used styles: div { text-align: center ; }

Image Series With Line Break

Too many images to fit in one row, so the browser will - like text - break into next line.

Three images should suffice here to break the margin.

With HTML figure

Additional styling is necessary to overwrite standard figure block display, i.e. "one figure per line"

Used styles: figure { float: left ; text-align: center ; }

With HTML div

Additional styling is necessary to overwrite standard div block display and for spacing (whitespace) between the divs

Used styles: div { float: left ; margin: 1em ; text-align: center ; }

Image Series Without Line Break

Images should be displayed in one line with horizontal scrolling.

With HTML figure

Requires an encapsulating div that controls the overflow.

Ordering in one horizontal line is now achieved with display: table-cell, for this a padding has to be defined (margin does not work for / between cells).

Used styles:

  • Outer div: overflow: auto ;
  • figures: display: table-cell ; padding: 1em ; text-align: center ;

With HTML div

Requires an encapsulating div that controls the overflow.

Ordering in one horizontal line is now achieved with display: table-cell, for this a padding has to be defined (margin does not work for / between cells).

Used styles:

  • Outer div: overflow: auto ;
  • Image with caption divs: display: table-cell ; padding: 1em ; text-align: center ;

Multiple Image Series Without Line Break

Multiple parallel lines of images scrolling together horizontally.

With HTML figure

Each row of images encapsulated in an own div, "controlled" by shared outer div.

Used styles:

  • Outer div: overflow: auto ;
  • figures: display: table-cell ; padding: 1em ; text-align: center ;

With HTML div

Each row of images encapsulated in an own div, "controlled" by shared outer div.

Used styles:

  • Outer div: overflow: auto ;
  • Image with caption divs: display: table-cell ; padding: 1em ; text-align: center ;
